description.narrative: The objective of the Second Dushanbe Water Supply Project for Tajikistan is to improve water utility performance and water supply services in selected areas of Dushanbe. There are four components to the project, the first component being metering and demand management. The component will finance consumption metering and bulk metering of water, for increased revenue, reduced wastage, and better tracking of losses, including: i) supply and installation of 76,500 residential meters (i.e. approximately 46 percent of Dushanbe Vodokanal (DVK) users; and installation of 1,500 apartment building master meters in selected areas of the city; ii) rehabilitation of 1,500 apartment building service connections; iii) supply and installation of bulk flow meters at water production facilities; iv) supply and installation of a Network Information System (NIS); v) communication strategy and public awareness campaigns to promote metering and demand management; and vi) installation of Supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) system. The second component is the water quality improvement. The components will support system upgrades for improved quality of water, including network cleaning. The third component is the institutional strengthening and capacity building. The component will finance activities to build institutional capacity and improve utility performance of DVK, which includes: carrying out an assessment of DVK's organizational and capacity-building needs; and installation of modern accounting, billing and water revenue collection systems. Finally, the fourth component is the implementation support.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :4.01 (a) | Description :The POM shall have been amended, suspended, abrogated or waived without IDA™s priorconsent. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :4.01 (b) | Description :The OPIAP shall have been amended, suspended, abrogated or waived without IDA™s priorconsent, and/or the PIE and/or the Municipality of Dushanbe has not been acting in compliance with the OPIAP | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :4.01 (c) | Description :The PIE™s Legislation has been amended, suspended, abrogated, repealed or waived so asto affect materially and adversely the ability of the PIE to perform any of its obligations under Project | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :5.01 (a) | Description :The Subsidiary Agreement has been executed on behalf of the Recipient, the PIE and theMunicipality of Dushanbe | Due Date :11-Oct-2011
Finance Agreement :5.01 (b) | Description :The Recipient shall have caused the PIE to adopt the POM, satisfactory to IDA | Due Date:11-Oct-2011

Finance Agreement :FA: Schedule 2, Section I, A. 7. | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that the Municipality of Dushanbe hasapproved the establishment of a new organizational structure for the Project Implementing Entity, acceptable to the Association. |Due Date :31-Dec-2015

Finance Agreement :FA: Schedule 2, Section I, A. 8. | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that the Project Implementing Entityhas successfully completed the installation of a customer management system, acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :31-Dec-2015

Finance Agreement :FA: Schedule 2, Section I, A. 9. | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that the Project Implementing Entityhas successfully completed the recruitment process for the Deputy Director of Finance and Deputy Director of Customer Service, withprofessional qualifications and experience acceptable to the Association. | Due Date :31-Dec-2015

Finance Agreement :PA, Schedule, Section II, B, 4.a | Description :DVK must keep its debt service coverage ratio above 1.2. Theintroduction of new accounting rules causes DVK's DSCR to drop to 0.75in 2013. Without the rules change, it would be 1.27.Artificial non compliance may not require remedial actions, but team has suggested that GOT and DVK revisit the debt serviceassociated to the onlending of the DWSP1 IDA grant. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA: Schedule, Section II, B, 4. | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shall maintain, throughout theimplementation of the Project, the Project Implementing Entity's internal audit unit, with a composition, resources and terms ofreference satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA: Schedule, Section II, B, 5. | Description :Except as the Association shall otherwise agree, the PIE shallnot incur any debt, unless a reasonable forecast of the revenues and expenditures of the PIE shows that its estimated net revenuesfor each fiscal year during the term of the debt to be incurred shall be at least 1.2 times its estimated debt service requirementsin such year on all of its debt including the debt to be incurred. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA: Schedule, Section II, B, 6. | Description :Except as the Association shall otherwise agree, the ProjectImplementing Entity shall maintain for each of its fiscal years during implementation of the Project a ratio of total operatingexpenses to total operating revenues not higher than 0.9. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, A (12) | Description :The Recipient shall cause the Municipality of Dushanbe to provide financing tothe PIE in an amount equivalent to US$3,000,000 fromits own resources on terms and conditions acceptable to IDA | Frequency :Yearly

actual.value: Digitalization and GIS mapping of the network is fully completed.

baseline.value: Billing software is not available; the billing is based on norms

target.value: System is fully operational with necessary technical support in place;

actual.value: System is fully operational with necessary technical support in place.

title.narrative: Supply of modern water testing laboratory equipment to DVK

baseline.value: Current outdated equipment used by DVK laboratories

title.narrative: Completion of training in monitoring of energy costs and energy audit

baseline.value: DVK does no™t have themethodology for conducting the energy audit

title.narrative: Reconstruction of filters at SAM treatment plant

actual.value: target achieved. The 1st filter tranche was completed and commenced into operation in June 2017. The 2nd tranche is completed andcommenced into operation in October, 2019.

title.narrative: Completion of the Tariff and Connection fee study

actual.value: Target achieved. The study is completed and presented to stakeholders in November 2019.

title.narrative: Introduction of rechlorination systems in the network

actual.value: Five systems installed. The target is fully met.

title.narrative: Completion of the water supply masterplan
Reduction of technical water losses in the pilot area of Dushanbe

actual.value: The conceptual hydraulic simulation is at final stage. Contract W-03 for replacement of pipes is at the advanced stage. Lossreduction attributive to the project is estimated at 3%.

title.narrative: Availability of water supply services - Percentage of customers with 24h of water supply service per day
Improved water quality (in general) - Percentage of customers, satisfied with water quality
